item.title: NORTH LAS VEGAS, Nev. (AP) — A veteran Democratic state senator now running for mayor of North Las Vegas said Friday that her 21-year-old adopted son shot and wounded her nephew at her home while she was at a community event.

item.title: ATHERTON, Calif. (AP) — Three decades after a car was reported stolen in Northern California, police are digging the missing convertible out of the yard of a $15 million mansion built by a man with a history of arrests for murder, attempted murder and insurance fraud.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Two men were arrested Friday after they allegedly robbed an armored car outside a Los Angeles County bank earlier this week and shot a guard several times in an ambush, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: NEW YORK (AP) — Two men were convicted Friday for an armed robbery of more than a quarter-million dollars from New York’s famed Aqueduct Racetrack, in a heist that echoed a fictional crime from an Stanley Kubrick film.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: ROCKFORD, Ill. (AP) — A jury found a northern Illinois ice skating coach guilty of aggravated criminal sexual abuse involving a young skater.The verdict against Eugene Heffron, 83, was announced Friday by the Winnebago County state's attorney's office.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Prohibitions against nonunanimous jury convictions — outlawed by Louisiana voters in 2018 and, later, by the U.S. Supreme Court — do not have to apply retroactively to earlier convictions, Louisiana's highest court ruled Friday.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: ST. LOUIS (AP) — Relatives confronted the man who fatally shot a former star of the St. Louis-based reality TV show “Welcome to Sweetie Pie’s” when he was sentenced to 32 years in prison. “How can you sleep?” Kalyn Griggs asked Travell Anthony Hill as the 31-year-old was sentenced Thursday on two murder-for-hire charges in the the March 2016 death of Griggs' brother, Andre Montgomery.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — A man convicted of shooting two southern Indiana judges during a fight outside an Indianapolis fast food restaurant in 2019 was sentenced Friday to eight years in prison.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) — A suspect in the killing of three men who police have said were among six victims of a serial killer in Northern California may have used a firearm without a serial number, also known as a ghost gun, police said.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Philadelphia’s elected prosecutor said Friday he’s making plans to defend himself against a possible impeachment process by the Republican-controlled Legislature and that it could begin as early as next week.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: CROWN POINT, Ind. (AP) — A northwestern Indiana man who pleaded guilty to fatally shooting his 9-year-old daughter as he was talking to her two brothers about gun safety won't serve any prison time for her 2017 death.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: BATON ROUGE (AP) — Nine people were injured early Friday during a shooting at a fraternity house outside of Southern University in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, authorities said.While seven people were taken to the hospital, none of the injuries appear life-threatening, according to Baton Rouge police.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: NEW YORK (AP) — Charles Cullen is by some estimates the most prolific serial killer in American history. But when Krysty Wilson-Cairns began writing the script about his capture, she started not with Cullen, who was sentenced to consecutive life sentences in 2006, but outside the home of Amy Loughren, the nurse who first uncovered his crimes.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: ATLANTA (AP) — A Georgia sheriff standing trial on federal charges that he abusing detainees' rights by strapping them into restraint chairs as a form of punishment denied wrongdoing Thursday, insisting the chairs are safe as long as jailers follow provided rules.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: WINNETKA, Ill. (AP) — A white woman charged with a hate crime following a confrontation where she told a group of Black men in 2020 that they couldn't be at a suburban Chicago beach has been sentenced to probation after pleading guilty to a lesser charge.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: LOUISIANA, Mo. (AP) — The police chief in a small Missouri town has been charged with felony drug crimes after his girlfriend's brother was found dead from an apparent overdose in the police chief’s apartment.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former President Donald Trump signed legal documents challenging the results of the 2020 election that included voter fraud claims he knew to be false, a federal judge said in a ruling Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: CORUNNA, Mich. (AP) — A Michigan man who acknowledged killing another man and hanging the mutilated body from a ceiling will face life in prison without parole after a judge said Wednesday that it was premeditated murder.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — Crime in Chicago generated the most heat in Thursday's debate for Illinois governor Tuesday, with Republican Darren Bailey suggesting that fighting lawlessness should start outside the city — with a tighter U.S.-Mexican border and an end to Chicago's “sanctuary city” status.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: ALPENA, Mich. (AP) — Two men in northern Michigan were charged in the deaths of two women whose homicides occurred weeks apart but were connected, authorities said Wednesday.The disappearances of Brynn Bills and Abby Hill have received much publicity in the Alpena area.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) — Newly released police bodycam footage shows that three of the 20 people who were arrested in Florida for allegedly voting illegally in the 2020 election appeared to be surprised that they had done anything wrong.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Supporters of a U.N. resolution that would demand an immediate end to violence and criminal activity in Haiti and impose sanctions on influential gang leader Jimmy Cherizier, nicknamed “Barbecue,” said Wednesday a vote has been delayed.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Philippine officials say they have shut down at least 214 illegal Chinese offshore gambling operations and deported the first six of nearly 400 Chinese workers who have been detained under a renewed crackdown.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — One migrant is dead, another is wounded and at least seven others are languishing in detention three weeks after twin brothers allegedly opened fire on them in the Texas desert, claiming they mistook them for wild hogs during a hunting trip.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: ATLANTA (AP) — Two former jail detainees testified that deputies of a Georgia sheriff charged with violating their civil rights kept them in restraint chairs for hours, causing them to urinate on themselves while they were bound.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The father of Kristin Smart, the California Central Coast college student who vanished from campus 26 years ago, says a murder conviction hasn't ended the “agonizingly long journey" to find the truth about his daughter.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — Two students were injured in a shooting Tuesday afternoon near a high school in Portland, Oregon, officials said. Shots were fired near Jefferson High School in north Portland around 4 p.m.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The last man seen with Kristin Smart was convicted Tuesday of killing the college freshman, who vanished from a California campus more than 25 years ago, but his father was acquitted of helping him conceal the crime.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) — Prosecutors on Tuesday charged a Northern California man with fatally shooting three men whom police have said were among six victims slain by a serial killer over the past year and a half.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: ATLANTA (AP) — Republican state Sen. Burt Jones is running for Georgia lieutenant governor on a platform of fighting inflation and crime and improving education. But Democrat Charlie Bailey is focusing on Jones’ efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) — A man testified Tuesday that he saw an acquaintance shoot his friend and business partner, unprovoked, outside his Tennessee home in a killing that authorities said sparked a daylong crime rampage that paralyzed Memphis and led to an intense manhunt.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: PRISTINA, Kosovo (AP) — The Kosovar prosecutors’ office on Tuesday said an ethnic Serb accused of killing ethnic Albanians in 1999 was arrested in Hungary.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — A man has been convicted of reckless homicide in the fatal 2020 shooting of a young Black man in Indianapolis during unrest sparked by outrage over George Floyd’s killing by Minneapolis police.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: NEW YORK (AP) — Thieves stole 20 cars from a New York City dealership and will likely use the vechicles to commit other crimes, a top police official said.The car thieves hit a Mistubishi dealership over the weekend, broke open a lock box that held keys and drove off with late-model cars, NYPD Chief of Detectives James Essig said Monday.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: VIENNA (AP) — Six men went on trial in Vienna on Tuesday over their alleged links to a sympathizer of the Islamic State group who carried out a deadly shooting in the Austrian capital in 2020. A verdict in the trial at the Vienna state court is expected in February at the earliest, public broadcaster ORF reported.
item.dc:creator: https://www.offcampuscareer.com/sitemapscanner/new

item.title: COPENHAGEN, Denmark (AP) — Danish officials on Tuesday confirmed that there has been “extensive damage” to the Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines in the Baltic Sea off Denmark and that the cause of the damage was “powerful explosions.”
